cab.content: 30$O /iFromToWy Jfr^s^^ / -(This Document Is the Property of36His B*SECRET.OPERATIONS.General Delme-Radcliffe, Italy C.I.G.S., War Office.Despatched 4.40 p.m. 18.12.1917. Received 3.55, a.m. 19.12.1917.Ho. 10053.18th December.Morning.4th Army. This morning enemy attacked after heavy bombardment on the front Ca dJanna Monte Asolone and succeeded in capturing both objectives. An Italian division has been ordered to make a counter-attack but result not yet known. The only road for wheel traffic up the Grappa is threatened by capture of,Monte /isclone. The enemy has secured a footing on Monte Valderva on front 18th Corps.From other parts of the front nothing special to report,
